title: Useful patterns for building HTML tools with LLMs
description: Simon Willison shares comprehensive patterns for building single-file HTML applications using LLMs. He has built over 150 HTML tools in the past two years, almost all written by LLMs, combining HTML, JavaScript, and CSS in a single file. Key patterns include avoiding React build steps, loading dependencies from CDNs, persisting state in URLs, using localStorage for secrets, collecting CORS-enabled APIs, and leveraging WebAssembly for expanded capabilities. The article demonstrates how LLMs can create sophisticated tools ranging from SVG renderers to OCR applications.
author: Simon Willison

title: DeepMind's New Game AI Makes History
description: Two Minute Papers covers Google DeepMind's breakthrough AI that can play multiple modern 3D games simultaneously, rather than mastering just one game. This represents a significant advancement in general game-playing AI capabilities.
author: Two Minute Papers

title: Code Agents: The Future of Agentic AI
description: Towards Data Science explores LLM agents that 'think' and act using Python code, focusing on generating and executing actual code rather than calling tools via JSON. This represents a shift toward more direct code-based AI agent architectures.
author: Towards Data Science

title: Rethinking Technology Stack Selection with AI Coding
description: ArXiv paper addressing the gap between LLM code generation results and actual requirements, analyzing LLMs as popular developer tools and their impact on technology stack selection processes.
author: ArXiv Research

title: A Developer's Guide to Building Scalable AI: Workflows vs Agents
description: Towards Data Science provides guidance on structured LLM pipelines with clear control flow, covering tool usage, context retrieval, model calling, and handling for scalable AI application development.
author: Towards Data Science
